ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Does this section apply to subject?
Which came first (mood changes/psychotic symptoms) or (alcohol/drugs)?
Notes: 1= Mood changes/psychotic symptoms occurred first; 2= Alcohol/drug abuse occurred first; 3= Mood changes/psychotic symptoms and alcohol/drug abuse occurred at the same time; 4= Not Clear

ElementDescription: If Mood changes/psychotic symptoms occurred first: Did you have (mood changes/psychotic symptoms) right before you started using (alcohol/drugs) heavily?
For how long did you have (mood changes/psychotic symptoms) right before you started using (alcohol/drugs) heavily? Days
For how long did you have (mood changes/psychotic symptoms) right before you started using (alcohol/drugs) heavily? Weeks
If Alcohol/drugs occurred first: Were you using (alcohol/drugs) heavily right before you had (mood changes/psychotic symptoms)?
For how long were you using (alcohol/drugs) heavily right before your (mood changes/psychotic symptoms) began? Days
For how long were you using (alcohol/drugs) heavily right before your (mood changes/psychotic symptoms) began? Weeks
Now I would like you to think about other episodes of (Mood changes/Psychotic symptoms) and tell me which statement on the card best characterizes these episodes.
Notes: 1= Emotional/thinking difficulties always occurred first; 2= Alcohol/drug abuse always occurred first; 3= Emotional/thinking difficulties and alcohol/drug abuse always occurred at the same time; 4= No strict pattern (sometimes emotional/thinking difficulties first, sometimes alcohol drugs first); 5= Emotional/thinking difficulties and alcohol/drug abuse always occurred independently; 6= Not Clear

ElementDescription: Have your (Mood/Psychotic) episodes ever continued after you stopped using (Alcohol/Drugs) heavily?
What was the longest time a (Mood/Psychotic) episode ever continued after you stopped using (Alcohol/Drugs)? Days
What was the longest time a (Mood/Psychotic) episode ever continued after you stopped using (Alcohol/Drugs)? Weeks
Did you ever continue to use (Alcohol/Drugs) heavily after your (Mood/Psychotic) episode stopped?
What was the longest you used (Alcohol/Drugs) heavily after a (Mood/Psychotic) episode stopped? Days
What was the longest you used (Alcohol/Drugs) heavily after a (Mood/Psychotic) episode stopped? Weeks
